result.execSummary:
The defendant Elizabeth K Koty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Collection may include income assignment.

No contact with the victim or the business.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Elizabeth K Koty in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing. State presents arguments. Defense presents arguments. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS JAIL

TERM OF PROBATION: 12 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with the victim or the business
 
COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DRGOD Surcharge $10.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 30 DAYS, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.
Sentencing hearing at 04-27-2016 03:00 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Elizabeth K Koty in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the amended information. Attorney Weathers is requesting a separate sentencing date. Court grants.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
